hints.Brain: Processes sensory information and controls body functions.
hints.Heart: Pumps blood and circulates oxygen and nutrients.
hints.Lungs: Facilitate respiration by exchanging oxygen and carbon dioxide.
hints.Liver: Filters blood, breaks down toxins, and metabolizes nutrients.
hints.Kidneys: Remove waste products and regulate electrolyte balance.
hints.Stomach: Breaks down food using gastric acid and enzymes.
hints.Skin: Protects the body, regulates temperature, and detects sensations.
hints.Muscles: Contract and relax to facilitate movement and maintain posture.
hints.Bones: Provide structural support, protect organs, and store minerals.
hints.Spinal Cord: Transmits signals between the brain and the rest of the body.
hints.Blood: Transports oxygen, nutrients, and waste products throughout the body.
hints.Pancreas: Produces digestive enzymes and hormones, such as insulin.
hints.Spleen: Filters blood and helps the immune system fight infections.
hints.Esophagus: Transports food from the mouth to the stomach.
hints.Trachea: Transports air to and from the lungs.
hints.Endocrine System: A collection of glands that secrete hormones to regulate various body functions, such as growth, metabolism, and reproduction.
hints.Lymphatic System: A network of vessels and nodes that transport and filter lymph fluid, support the immune system, and help maintain fluid balance in the body.
hints.Tendons: Connective tissue that attaches muscles to bones, facilitating movement.
hints.Ligaments: Connective tissue that connects bones to other bones, providing joint stability.
hints.Cartilage: Flexible, semi-rigid connective tissue that provides support, reduces friction, and absorbs shock in joints.
hints.Periosteum: A dense membrane that covers the surface of bones, providing nourishment and supporting bone growth.
hints.Fascia: A layer of fibrous connective tissue that surrounds and separates muscles, organs, and other structures.
hints.Synovial Joints: Joints that contain a lubricating synovial fluid and allow for a wide range of motion, such as the knee or elbow.
hints.Neurons: Specialized cells that transmit electrical signals within the nervous system.
hints.Hormones: Chemical messengers secreted by endocrine glands that regulate various physiological processes in the body.
hints.Platelets: Small blood cell fragments that play a crucial role in blood clotting and wound healing.
hints.Bronchi: The main airways that branch from the trachea into the lungs, facilitating the passage of air.
hints.Alveoli: Tiny air sacs in the lungs where the exchange of oxygen and carbon dioxide takes place.
hints.Gallbladder: A small organ that stores bile produced by the liver, releasing it into the small intestine to aid digestion.
hints.Thyroid: An endocrine gland located in the neck that produces hormones regulating metabolism and growth.
